snippet: The Target Margin Theater production of “Uncle Vanya” suggests a group of passionate college students who, after a long night of punch-drunk debate, have decided to act out one of their favorite Chekhov plays.
lead_paragraph: Hey, guys, what say we have a Chekhov slumber party? We'll put on our pajamas, open a few bottles of vodka and sit around and talk about how hopeless our lives are -- maybe with Russian accents. Come on, it'll be fun. That's the implicit invitation issued by the Target Margin Theater's antic riff on Chekhov's ''Uncle Vanya,'' which runs through May 19 at the Here Arts Center. And you know what? It is kind of fun, at least if you're already familiar with the play that's being taken apart.
